metadata.titleEn: A long term hourly eddy covariance dataset of consistently processed CO2 and H2O Fluxes from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe at Nam Co (2005 - 2019)
metadata.titleCn: A long term half-hourly eddy covariance dataset of consistently processed CO2 and H2O Fluxes from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe at Nam Co (2005 - 2019)
metadata.description: The data set contains nearly 15 years of eddy covariance data  from an alpine steppe ecosystem on the central Tibetan Plateau.The data was processed following standardized quality control methods to allow for comparability between the different years of  our record and with other data sets. To ensure meaningful  estimates of ecosystem atmosphere exchange, careful application of the following correction procedures and analyses was necessary: (1) Due to the remote location, continuous maintenance of the eddy covariance (EC) system was not always possible, so that cleaning and calibration of the sensors was performed irregularly. Furthermore, the high proportion of bare soil and high wind speeds led to accumulation of dirt in the measurement path of the infrared gas analyzer (IRGA). The installation of the sensor in such a challenging environment resulted in a considerable drift in CO2 and H2O gas density measurements. If not accounted for, this concentration bias may distort the estimation of the carbon uptake. We applied a modified drift correction procedure following Fratini et al. (2014) which, instead of a linear interpolation  between calibration dates, uses the CO2 concentration measurements  from the Mt. Waliguan atmospheric observatory as reference time series. (2) We applied rigorous quality filtering of the calculated fluxes to retain only fluxes which represent actual physical processes. (3) During the long measurement period, there were several buildings constructed in the near vicinity of the EC system. We investigated the influence of these obstacles on the turbulent flow regime to identify fluxes with uncertain land cover contribution and exclude them from subsequent computations. (4) We calculated the de-facto standard correction for instrument surface heating during cold conditions (hereafter called sensor self heating correction) following Burba et al. (2008) and a revision of the original method following Frank and Massman (2020). (5)Subsequently, we applied the traditional and widely used gap filling procedure following Reichstein et al. (2005) to provide a more complete overview of the annual net ecosystem CO2 exchange.(6) We estimated the flux uncertainty by calculating the random flux error (RE) following Finkelstein and Sims (2001) and by using the standard deviation of the fluxes used for gap filling(NEE_fsd) as a measure for spatial and temporal variation.
metadata.descriptionCn: The data set contains nearly 15 years of eddy covariance data  from an alpine steppe ecosystem on the central Tibetan Plateau.The data was processed following standardized quality control methods to allow for comparability between the different years of  our record and with other data sets. To ensure meaningful  estimates of ecosystem atmosphere exchange, careful application of the following correction procedures and analyses was necessary: (1) Due to the remote location, continuous maintenance of the eddy covariance (EC) system was not always possible, so that cleaning and calibration of the sensors was performed irregularly. Furthermore, the high proportion of bare soil and high wind speeds led to accumulation of dirt in the measurement path of the infrared gas analyzer (IRGA). The installation of the sensor in such a challenging environment resulted in a considerable drift in CO2 and H2O gas density measurements. If not accounted for, this concentration bias may distort the estimation of the carbon uptake. We applied a modified drift correction procedure following Fratini et al. (2014) which, instead of a linear interpolation  between calibration dates, uses the CO2 concentration measurements  from the Mt. Waliguan atmospheric observatory as reference time series. (2) We applied rigorous quality filtering of the calculated fluxes to retain only fluxes which represent actual physical processes. (3) During the long measurement period, there were several buildings constructed in the near vicinity of the EC system. We investigated the influence of these obstacles on the turbulent flow regime to identify fluxes with uncertain land cover contribution and exclude them from subsequent computations. (4) We calculated the de-facto standard correction for instrument surface heating during cold conditions (hereafter called sensor self heating correction) following Burba et al. (2008) and a revision of the original method following Frank and Massman (2020). (5)Subsequently, we applied the traditional and widely used gap filling procedure following Reichstein et al. (2005) to provide a more complete overview of the annual net ecosystem CO2 exchange.(6) We estimated the flux uncertainty by calculating the random flux error (RE) following Finkelstein and Sims (2001) and by using the standard deviation of the fluxes used for gap filling(NEE_fsd) as a measure for spatial and temporal variation.
metadata.instructions:
File name: NAMORS_EC_2005-2019.csv. The file contains the EddyPro full_output (https://www.licor.com/env/support/EddyPro/topics/output-files-full-output.html) and biomet data, quality flags for quality filtering and fetch filtering, the CO2 fluxes corrected for sensor self heating effects, random uncertainty measures as propagated via WPL correction and the REddyProc gap filling results (https://www.bgc-jena.mpg.de/bgi/index.php/Services/REddyProcWebOutput).
File name: NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_varnames_units.csv. The file contains the variable descriptions and physical units for the above mentioned dataset.
Version 2 with enhanced calculations and data  processing after peer-review(https://essd.copernicus.org/preprints/essd-2020-63/#discussion). The file "NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_v2.txt" contains the EddyProfull_output (https://www.licor.com/env/support/EddyPro/topics/output-files-full-output.html)and biomet data, quality flags for quality filtering, the CO2fluxes corrected for sensor self heating effects and the REddyProcgap filling results(https://www.bgc-jena.mpg.de/bgi/index.php/Services/REddyProcWebOutput).The file "NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_varnames_units_v2.txt" contains thevariable descriptions and physical units for the above mentioneddataset. The uploaded files are tab-delimited .txt files with"-9999" representing missing data.
metadata.instructionsCn:
File name: NAMORS_EC_2005-2019.csv. The file contains the EddyPro full_output (https://www.licor.com/env/support/EddyPro/topics/output-files-full-output.html) and biomet data, quality flags for quality filtering and fetch filtering, the CO2 fluxes corrected for sensor self heating effects, random uncertainty measures as propagated via WPL correction and the REddyProc gap filling results (https://www.bgc-jena.mpg.de/bgi/index.php/Services/REddyProcWebOutput).
File name: NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_varnames_units.csv. The file contains the variable descriptions and physical units for the above mentioned dataset.
Version 2 with enhanced calculations and data  processing after peer-review(https://essd.copernicus.org/preprints/essd-2020-63/#discussion). The file "NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_v2.txt" contains the EddyProfull_output (https://www.licor.com/env/support/EddyPro/topics/output-files-full-output.html)and biomet data, quality flags for quality filtering, the CO2fluxes corrected for sensor self heating effects and the REddyProcgap filling results(https://www.bgc-jena.mpg.de/bgi/index.php/Services/REddyProcWebOutput).The file "NAMORS_EC_2005-2019_varnames_units_v2.txt" contains thevariable descriptions and physical units for the above mentioneddataset. The uploaded files are tab-delimited .txt files with"-9999" representing missing data.

literatureList.titleEn: Addressing the influence of instrument surface heat exchange on the measurements of CO 2 flux from open-path gas analyzers
literatureList.referenceEn: Burba, G. G., McDermitt, D. K., Grelle, A., Anderson, D., and XU, L. (2008). Addressing the influence of instrument surface heat exchange on the measurements of CO 2 flux from open-path gas analyzers, Global Change Biology, 14, 1854–1876, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-2486.2008.01606.x.

literatureList.titleEn: A Long Term (2005–2019) Eddy Covariance Data Set of CO2 and H2O Fluxes from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe
literatureList.referenceEn: Nieberding, F., Wille, C., Fratini, G., Asmussen, M. O., Wang, Y., Ma, Y., & Sachs, T. (2020). A long-term (2005–2019) eddy covariance data set of CO2 and H2O fluxes from the Tibetan alpine steppe. Earth System Science Data. 12. 2705-2724. 10.5194/essd-12-2705-2020.

literatureList.titleEn: Tibetan Observation and Research Platform- Atmosphere–land interaction over a heterogeneous landscape
literatureList.referenceEn: Ma, Y.M., Kang, S.C., Zhu, L.P., Xu, B.Q., Tian, L.D., & Yao, T.D. (2008). Tibetan Observation and Research Platform- Atmosphere–land interaction over a heterogeneous landscape, Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society. 89, 1487–1492. doi:10.1175/2008BAMS2545.1.

literatureList.titleEn: Eddy-covariance flux errors due to biases in gas concentration measurements: origins, quantification and correction
literatureList.referenceEn: Fratini, G., McDermitt, D. K., and Papale, D. (2004). Eddy-covariance flux errors due to biases in gas concentration measurements: origins, quantification and correction, Biogeosciences, 11, 1037–1051, https://doi.org/10.5194/bg-11-1037-2014.

literatureList.titleEn: On the separation of net ecosystem exchange into assimilation and ecosystem respiration: review and improved algorithm

(20050. On the separation of net ecosystem exchange into assimilation and ecosystem respiration: review and improved algorithm, Global Change Biology, 11, 1424–1439, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-2486.2005.001002.x.

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific challenges and correction procedures involved in collecting and processing eddy covariance data from remote and challenging environments like the Tibetan Alpine Steppe?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在像西藏高山草甸这样的偏远和具有挑战性的环境中，收集和处理涡度协方差数据面临的具体挑战和纠正程序包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: irregular cleaning and calibration of sensors, accumulation of dirt affecting sensor readings, drift in CO2 and H2O measurements, using CO2 concentration measurements from a reference observatory for drift correction, quality filtering of fluxes, evaluating the influence of nearby constructions on turbulent flow, applying sensor self-heating corrections, gap filling, uncertainty estimation methods
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 传感器的不定期清洁和校准、污垢积累影响传感器读数、CO2和H2O测量的漂移、使用参考观测站的CO2浓度测量进行漂移校正、通量的质量过滤、评估附近建筑对湍流流动的影响、应用传感器自加热校正、缺口填补、不确定性估计方法。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many years of data are included in the eddy covariance dataset from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 西藏高原草甸的涡度协方差数据集包含多少年的数据？

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data correction procedures applied in a dataset from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe compare to those used in other remote eddy covariance sites in terms of addressing sensor drift and environmental challenges?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在藏族高原草甸的数据集中应用的数据修正程序与其他遥感涡度协方差站点所使用的程序相比，在应对传感器漂移和环境挑战方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In a dataset from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe, a modified drift correction procedure is used, which references CO2 concentration measurements from a nearby atmospheric observatory instead of linear interpolation between calibration dates. This approach may differ from other remote eddy covariance sites that might rely on different reference data or interpolation methods. Additionally, the dataset addresses challenges such as dirt accumulation and high wind speeds, which might be more pronounced compared to other sites, requiring tailored correction procedures.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在来自西藏高山草甸的数据集中，采用了一种改进的漂移校正程序，该程序参考了附近大气观测站的CO2浓度测量，而不是在校准日期之间进行线性插值。这种方法可能与其他遥感涡度协方差站点有所不同，后者可能依赖于不同的参考数据或插值方法。此外，该数据集还解决了诸如污垢积累和高风速等挑战，这些问题在其他站点可能更为明显，因此需要量身定制的校正程序。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors cause the need for rigorous quality filtering of flux data in eddy covariance datasets collected from remote and challenging environments like the Tibetan Alpine Steppe?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在像西藏高山草甸这样的偏远和具有挑战性环境中收集的涡度协方差数据集需要严格质量过滤的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Due to the remote location of the eddy covariance system, continuous maintenance was not always possible, leading to irregular cleaning and calibration of sensors. Additionally, the high proportion of bare soil and high wind speeds resulted in the accumulation of dirt in the measurement path of the infrared gas analyzer (IRGA), causing a drift in CO2 and H2O gas density measurements. These factors necessitate rigorous quality filtering to retain fluxes that represent actual physical processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于涡度协方差系统的位置偏远，持续的维护并不总是可行，这导致传感器的清洁和校准不规律。此外，高比例的裸土和高风速导致红外气体分析仪（IRGA）测量路径中积累了污垢，从而导致CO2和H2O气体密度测量的漂移。这些因素需要严格的质量过滤，以保留代表实际物理过程的通量。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of irregular sensor maintenance and cleaning on the accuracy and reliability of a dataset collected in remote and challenging environments like the Tibetan Alpine Steppe?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 不规律的传感器维护和清洁对在遥远和具有挑战性的环境（如西藏高山草甸）中收集的数据集的准确性和可靠性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Irregular sensor maintenance and cleaning can lead to the accumulation of dirt in the measurement path of instruments such as the infrared gas analyzer (IRGA), causing considerable drift in CO2 and H2O gas density measurements. This drift, if uncorrected, can distort the estimation of carbon uptake, impacting the accuracy and reliability of the dataset. A modified drift correction procedure may be necessary to address these issues and ensure meaningful estimates of ecosystem-atmosphere exchange.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 不规律的传感器维护和清洁可能导致仪器（如红外气体分析仪（IRGA））测量路径中积累污垢，从而导致CO2和H2O气体密度测量出现显著漂移。如果不加以修正，这种漂移可能会扭曲碳吸收的估算，影响数据集的准确性和可靠性。可能需要修改漂移修正程序，以解决这些问题并确保生态系统-大气交换的有意义估算。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary aim of creating a dataset of long-term half-hourly eddy covariance CO2 and H2O fluxes from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建来自西藏高原草甸的长期半小时eddy covariance CO2和H2O通量数据集的主要目的是。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary aim of creating a dataset of long-term half-hourly eddy covariance CO2 and H2O fluxes from the Tibetan Alpine Steppe is to provide a comprehensive record of ecosystem-atmosphere exchanges over nearly 15 years. This involves consistent data processing and quality control to ensure comparability across different years and with other datasets. The dataset serves to enhance understanding of carbon and water flux dynamics in alpine steppe ecosystems, particularly in challenging environments like the central Tibetan Plateau, where factors such as soil conditions, wind, and sensor drift can affect data accuracy.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 创建一个来自西藏高原草甸的长期半小时二氧化碳和水蒸气通量的数据库的主要目的是提供近15年的生态系统-大气交换的综合记录。这涉及到一致的数据处理和质量控制，以确保不同年份之间以及与其他数据集的可比性。该数据集旨在增强对高原草甸生态系统中碳和水通量动态的理解，特别是在像中央西藏高原这样具有挑战性的环境中，土壤条件、风和传感器漂移等因素可能会影响数据的准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures must be followed to ensure the correction of sensor drift in long-term CO2 and H2O flux measurements in remote alpine steppes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保在偏远高山草甸中长期CO2和H2O通量测量的传感器漂移得到纠正，必须遵循哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To correct sensor drift in long-term CO2 and H2O flux measurements in remote alpine steppes, a modified drift correction procedure is necessary. This involves using CO2 concentration measurements from a reference time series, such as the Mt. Waliguan atmospheric observatory, instead of linear interpolation between calibration dates. This approach helps in accounting for potential biases in concentration measurements due to irregular sensor calibration and environmental challenges.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了纠正远程高山草甸中长期CO2和H2O通量测量的传感器漂移，需要采用一种改进的漂移校正程序。这涉及使用参考时间序列中的CO2浓度测量，例如Mt. Waliguan大气观测站，而不是在校准日期之间进行线性插值。这种方法有助于考虑由于不规则的传感器校准和环境挑战而导致的浓度测量潜在偏差。
